newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland's Ciech chemicals trader approves IPO.
newsitem.headline: Poland's Ciech chemicals trader approves IPO.

text.p: Shareholders of Poland's largest chemicals trader Ciech SA approved on Tuesday an initial public offering of up to 14.2 million shares ex-rights and a share offer for its employees, PAP news agency said.
PAP said that Ciech shareholders' meeting approved a public issue of between seven million and 14,203,984 shares and an employee offer of between three and six million shares.
PAP, which quoted the meeting's resolutions, said the shareholders also approved Ciech's privatisation plan.

It gave no further details but last month Ciech's president Zdzislaw Matkiewicz said the company planned to raise 200-400 million zlotys from the new issue and Warsaw bourse listing in the second quarter of 1997.
The state treasury currently holds about 51 percent of Ciech with the rest owned by numerous, mostly state-owned companies in the chemical sector.
